decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, card advantage, and powerful threats. Using cards like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Mindbreak Trap to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm to maintain card advantage. The deck is able to generate additional value through cards like Gifts Ungiven and Lurrus of the Dream-Den, while also having access to powerful win conditions like Time Vault and LÃ³rien Revealed. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebears to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying aggressive pressure. It includes cards like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down opposing decks. The mana base is designed to support fast plays with cards like Black Lotus and Moxen, while also utilizing lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also has synergy with cards like Witch Enchanter and Clarion Conqueror to generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces needed to execute a Doomsday win condition, using cards like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to search for key pieces. It also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The deck has a low mana curve and utilizes efficient cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for cards, aiming to quickly assemble the necessary resources to win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Psychic Frog.

This aggressive MUD deck focuses on assembling a powerful board state quickly and overwhelming the opponent with fast mana acceleration, artifact synergy, and powerful threats. The deck utilizes mana rocks like Mana Vault and Grim Monolith to power out threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. The deck also includes key pieces like Time Vault and The One Ring for added combo potential, along with disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Pithing Needle to control the game. The goal is to establish dominance early and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. By using powerful mana acceleration cards like Moxen and Dark Ritual, along with disruptive elements like Null Rod and Wasteland, the deck aims to gain an early advantage and keep the opponent on the back foot. The aggressive creatures like Grief, Deathrite Shaman, and Mai, Scornful Striker are supported by hand disruption spells like Reanimate and Demonic Tutor, allowing the deck to quickly close out games through a combination of creature beatdown and resource denial.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal while utilizing card advantage and powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. It also includes disruptive cards like Wasteland and Lavinia to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy until it can establish a winning position through card advantage and powerful threats like Lurrus of the Dream-Den. The deck's mana base is designed to support its color requirements and allow for strong tempo plays.

This Esper Control deck is centered around using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes key cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den for additional value and recursion. The deck aims to establish board control through cards like Wasteland and Swords to Plowshares, while also generating card advantage with spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. With a focus on control and disruption, this deck looks to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through attrition.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on using aggressive Hatebears to disrupt opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures. The deck utilizes powerful hate cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent, while Anointed Peacekeeper and Clarion Conqueror provide protection and evasion for the aggressive creature plan. The mana base is streamlined with powerful accelerants like Black Lotus and Moxen, along with disruptive land cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using hatebears to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining aggression through efficient creatures. It utilizes cards like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent's plays, while also playing Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer to pressure the opponent. The inclusion of hate cards like Void Mirror and Wasteland further hinders the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game through disruptive creatures and deny the opponent's resources to secure a victory.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on using Coveted Jewel as a key piece in a combo strategy. The deck includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Mana Crypt to ramp up quickly, as well as cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to assemble the combo pieces. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage to find and activate Coveted Jewel, allowing the player to take multiple extra turns and gain a significant advantage over the opponent. Tezzeret, Cruel Captain can also assist in finding and utilizing the Jewel for maximum impact.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and card draw to generate mana quickly and effectively, allowing for powerful combos with cards like Paradoxical Outcome. The goal is to quickly assemble key pieces like Time Vault and Mana Vault with cards like Manifold Key and Oswald Fiddlebender, creating an overwhelming advantage in the game. The deck also includes disruption and control elements like Force of Will and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to protect the combo and control the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional resilience and flexibility to the deck.

This deck focuses on using the powerful card Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana while also providing protection with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. It includes a variety of powerful artifacts and mana sources to enable explosive plays and combo off quickly. The goal is to cycle through the deck, generate mana, and win the game through a powerful combination of cards, all while maintaining control of the board and protecting against disruption from the opponent.

The key strategy of this deck is to disrupt opponents' strategies using hatebear creatures like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, while also maintaining aggression with creatures like Clarion Conqueror and Anointed Peacekeeper. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts and lands to accelerate its game plan, such as Black Lotus and Ancient Tomb. By combining disruption and aggression, this deck aims to control the game and outpace opponents in order to secure a victory in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on using powerful counterspells and card draw to control the game while maintaining a strong board presence with efficient removal spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to continuously recur low-cost permanents from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by constantly disrupting their game plan and maintaining a steady stream of threats and answers.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out Atraxa, Grand Unifier and using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play. It has plenty of control elements such as Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and counterspells to protect its game plan. Show and Tell and Flash are used to put big threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Vexing Bauble to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes powerful cards like Black Lotus and Boseiju, Who Endures.

This Vintage Aggro-MUD deck focuses on fast mana acceleration and artifact synergies to overpower opponents. By utilizing powerful artifacts like the Moxen and Black Lotus, as well as mana sources like Mana Crypt and Ancient Tomb, this deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional utility and threats, while The One Ring and Time Vault offer alternative win conditions. With a mix of efficient threats and lock pieces, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can establish their own game plan.
